creator: Volthaus Electronics Laboratory
title: Automatic Night Light
materials_required: LDR: also known as a Photocell - Photo Resistor - Light Dependent Resistor
description: This project creates an automatic night light that glows only when the room is very dim, powered by a 9V battery with a built-in 5V regulated power supply for long-lasting operation.
steps: Gather all the required components: SPST on/off switch, LM7805 Voltage Regulator, 0.33uF ceramic capacitor, 0.1uF ceramic capacitor, 820R ohm resistor, 100k resistor, LED, TRANSISTOR 2N3904 NPN, LDR, 9 volt battery snap, 9 volt battery, breadboard.
Assemble the circuit according to the provided schematic. The schematic can be designed in software such as CadSoft's Eagle.
Build the voltage regulator circuit first and test to ensure it outputs 5 volts. This ensures the night light operates correctly even as the 9V battery drains.
Assemble the complete circuit on the breadboard. The LED should light up when the LDR is in complete darkness (e.g., covered with a pen cap).
